Welcome to JanggiGame’s documentation!¶

class JanggiGame.JanggiGame¶

Instantiates a new game of Janggi

class Advisor(color, ident)¶

Class for Advisor. Inherits from Mobile. Advisors must stay in the fortress and may move in any direction one square at a time

class Cannon(color, ident)¶

Class for Cannon. Inherits from Mobile

class Chariot(color, ident)¶

Class for Chariot. Inherits from Mobile. May move orthogonally any distance and diagonally inside the fortress.

class Elephant(color, ident)¶

Class for Elephant. Inherits from Mobile.

class General(color, ident)¶

Class for General. Inherits from Mobile. Can move 1 space in any direction but may never leave fortress. Generals may never directly face either other without an intervening piece. To do so is to cause a draw

class Horse(color, ident)¶

Class for Horse. Inherits from Mobile. Horses may move one diagonal/vertical space and one diagonal space Horses may not move through blocked spaces.

class Mobile(color, identification)¶

Defines mobile objects within the game

check_in_fortress()¶

Checks to see if piece is in fortress

get_color()¶

Gets color :return private data color

get_id()¶

Gets ID :return private data ID code

get_in_fortress()¶

Gets the status of being in the fortress :return private data boolean inside_fortress

get_legal_moves()¶

Returns legal moves of a piece :return list of coordinates that are legal, parsed for being on board

get_location()¶

Gets location :return private data location

get_symbol()¶

Gets the symbol of the piece :return private data symbol

set_in_fortress()¶

Sets the piece to be in the fortress

set_location(location_x, location_y)¶

Sets location of the piece using inputs :param location_x: the x coordinate :param location_y: the y coordinate

set_out_fortress()¶

Sets the piece to be outside the fortress

class Soldier(color, ident)¶

“Class for Soldier. Inherits from Mobile. Can move 1 space forward or one space horizontal. 5 per game If enters fortress, can now move diagonal

change_turn()¶

Swaps the current turn between players. :return True on success, False on fail

check_if_in_check()¶

This determines if a general has been placed in check :return True if in check, False if not

check_if_in_mate()¶

Determines if a general is in checkmate. :return True if in checkmate, False if not.

draw_board()¶

Prints blank board state for debugging

draw_piece(piece)¶

Provides information on location and symbol of a game-piece :param: piece: the object representing the piece :return piece.get_symbol, the symbol representing the type of piece :return piece.getlocation, the current coordinates the piece is located

find_from_loc(x, y)¶

Finds a piece at a given coordinate :param x: the x coordinate to search :param y: the y coordinate to search :return: the piece object if one is found, False if not

get_advisor_list()¶

Gets advisor list :return private list of advisors

get_all_pieces()¶

Gets a list of lists of all pieces :return list of lists for all pieces on the board

get_board()¶

Gets board :return current board object

get_cannon_list()¶

Gets cannon list :return private list of cannons

get_chariot_list()¶

Gets chariot list :return private list of chariots

get_elephant_list()¶

Gets elephant list :return private list of elephants

get_game_state()¶

Gets game state :return current state of the game

get_general_list()¶

Gets General List :return private list of generals

get_horse_list()¶

Gets horse list :return private list of horses

get_soldier_list()¶

Gets soldier list :return private list of soldiers

get_turn()¶

Gets the current turn :return current player turn

is_in_check(player)¶

Returns if a player is in check by calling the respective check function param: player: the owner to check :return True if in check, False if not

make_move(move_from, move_to)¶

Moves a piece in spatial coordinates :param move_from: the coordinates moving from :param move_to: the coordinates moving to :return: True if successful, False if not

place_pieces()¶

Places all pieces on the board by ID code

remove_piece(identification, symbol)¶

Removes a captured piece from correct list through mutation :param identification: the ID code of the target :param symbol: the character representing a piece type

JanggiGame.generate_coordinate_grid()¶

Generates a coordinate grid for use in pruning legal moves :return a grid pattern representing the board

JanggiGame.generate_fortress_grid()¶

Generates a coordinate grid for use in pruning legal moves in the fortress :return a grid pattern representing the fortresses on the board

JanggiGame.parse_color(name)¶

Function to determine color of a game-piece based on ID tag :param name: the name of the piece :return the player if one exists, False if not
